basic.description:
The city from a geographical and planning perspective. Topics include origins of urbanism; mega; migrant, and global cities; urban competitiveness; land use planning and design; surburbanization and sprawl; new urban identities and culture; retailing transport; public space; private and temporary cities; urban poverty; politics and governance; sustainable urban futures.
LEARNING HOURS    120 (12L;18T;30O;60P)
basic.subject: GPHY
basic.title: Cities: Geography, Planning and Urban Life

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite of GPHY101 or permission of department.
